competitors.name: NVIDIA
competitors.notes: Leading US semiconductor company with $2.12T market cap; dominates GPUs, AI, data centers

competitors.name: AMD (Advanced Micro Devices)
competitors.notes: Long-time CPU rival with Ryzen and EPYC processors; gained market share with high-performance alternatives

competitors.name: TSMC
competitors.notes: World's largest semiconductor foundry with >50% market share; leads in advanced process technology

competitors.name: Samsung
competitors.notes: World's largest memory chip and smartphone maker; surpassed Intel in semiconductor revenue 2017-2018

competitors.name: Qualcomm
competitors.notes: World's leading 5G and mobile phone chip developer; dominates Android smartphone market

competitors.name: Broadcom
competitors.notes: Second largest US semiconductor company with $659.4B market cap

competitors.name: ARM
competitors.notes: UK-based company designing energy-efficient processors; dominant in mobile and expanding to PCs

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Technology company with custom processors for servers and mainframes

competitors.name: Marvell Technology Group
competitors.notes: Semiconductor company competing in data infrastructure

context: By 2024, Intel faced its most challenging competitive landscape. NVIDIA emerged as leading US semiconductor company ($2.12T market cap). Intel lagged behind TSMC and Samsung in advanced chip manufacturing. Intel introduced Arrow Lake processor with novel technologies to compete.
